arrParticipants.question: Me registré, ¿cuándo voy a ser añadida.o a la ruta?
arrParticipants.answer:
Si has recibido nuestro correo electrónico de confirmación, tu suscripción ha llegado con éxito. La anfitriona o el anfitrión del Loop ha sido notificada.o y se pondrá en contacto contigo para añadirte a la ruta.
Esto puede tomar un poco de tiempo ya que todos los anfitriones.as gestionan el Loop en su tiempo libre. La mayoría añade nuevos miembros una vez cada 2 a 4 semanas.

arrParticipants.question: ¿Hay reglas sobre cuánta cantidad de artículos se puede tomar de las bolsas?
arrParticipants.answer: No hay reglas estrictas pero ten en cuenta que el sistema funciona mejor cuando es equilibrado. Cada bolsa es diferente. A veces encuentras más, a veces no encuentras nada. ¡Pero cada artículo que se usa de nuevo es un buen negocio para todo el mundo!

arrParticipants.question: ¿Tienes que donar la misma cantidad de ropa que sacas?
arrParticipants.answer: No necesariamente, pero ten en cuenta que el sistema funciona mejor si hay un buen equilibrio entre lo que se toma y lo que se da. Los artículos desgastados, manchados o dañados no son bienvenidos.

arrParticipants.question: ¿Se puede poner ropa de talla diferente en la misma bolsa?
arrParticipants.answer:
Normalmente las bolsas mixtas funcionan bien, pues las tallas varían según la marca y las proporciones son diferentes según las personas.
Te recomendamos mezclar artículos de tallas 36 a 42 (S, M y L) y abrir un Loop separado para las tallas más grandes o más pequeñas.

arrParticipants.question: ¿Cómo evitar la situación "quien lo ve primero se lo queda"?
arrParticipants.answer:
No hay garantía de que vayas a encontrar algo que te gusta. A veces pasarán por tu casa bolsas que no contienen ningún artículo para ti.
Recuerda que hallar tu artículo soñado vale más que tener en tu ropero 10 artículos que no usas. Además, hacer feliz a alguien con un artículo que juntaba polvo en tu ropero es un componente importante (¡y divertido!) de la mentalidad Clothing Loop!

arrParticipants.question: ¿Qué se hace con la ropa abultada, como los abrigos de invierno, que no entran en la bolsa?
arrParticipants.answer: Puedes sacar fotos de los artículos grandes y compartirlas a través del canal de comunicación o en la aplicación Glide. La entrega se organiza entre las personas mediante mensaje privado.

arrParticipants.question: ¿También puedo poner zapatos en la bolsa?
arrParticipants.answer: El anfitrión o la anfitriona local decide si se puede o no añadir zapatos a la bolsa. Añade solo pares que están realmente "como nuevos", y no más de 2 pares por bolsa. Te pedimos que pongas los zapatos en una bolsa separada para evitar que toquen la ropa.

arrParticipants.question: Recibo el error: “tu cuenta ya existe”.
arrParticipants.answer:
Ya has creado una cuenta en el The Clothing Loop. Para registrarte en un Loop nuevo, primero tienes que iniciar sesión:
  1. Haz clic en la esquina superior derecha en el inicio de sesión.
  2. Introduce la dirección de correo electrónico que utilizaste para registrarte en tu Loop.
  3. Busca en tu correo electrónico, incluso en tu carpeta de spam, nuestro enlace de verificación (utilizamos un enlace en lugar de una contraseña).
  4. Podrás registrarte en un nuevo Loop.

arrHosts.question: ¿Cómo inicio un Loop?
arrHosts.answer: We got you covered! We wrote a simple manual with all the instructions that can be found in our Toolkit. Please benefit from the lessons we learned in the many years we have been doing this!

arrHosts.question: How to find people to join my Loop?
arrHosts.answer: Start small! Ask friends and acquaintances in your direct environment like your sports club or dance school. When you have a small crowd gathered, you can ask everyone to invite at least one more person, then the group will grow organically. You can also send out a press release to your local media. We already drafted you a template to fill in!

arrHosts.question: How much time will hosting a Loop cost me?
arrHosts.answer: Our volunteers say they spend on average 1½ hours per month on hosting the Loop.

arrHosts.question: How do I sign up a new Loop?
arrHosts.answer: We made you a simple guide with screenshots of every step. Still run into an issue? Send us an email!

arrHosts.question: How do I sign in on the website?
arrHosts.answer:
1. Click in the top right corner on login
  2. Enter the email address you used to register your Loop.
  3. Check your email (and spam folder!) for our verification link. We use a link instead of a password!
  4. Now you are signed in and can view and edit your Loop(s) and see new participants.

arrHosts.question: How can I start using the Glide app?
arrHosts.answer:
Yes! We made an app that you can very easily set up for your own Loop.

You can copy the app and use it within your group. You only have to fill in the address list in our downloadable template. It is super easy! Please get in touch via our email if you still run into trouble!

arrHosts.question: Are there images or graphic templates we can use?
arrHosts.answer: Absolutely, we made you a Toolkit where you can find logos, pictures and templates. Use as many as you like!

arrHosts.question: Introducing a “Ghost rider” in the Loop
arrHosts.answer: Once your Loop is ongoing for a while, you may want to change things up a little bit! You can then introduce a “ghost rider” bag that travels in the other direction, so all of a sudden you have other people before you in the route, and also other styles in the bag. If you do so, please make people aware that they shouldn’t put any items in the “ghost rider” bag that they have previously taken out of a regular bag. And keep the number of ghost rider bags limited to 1 or 2, to keep it special and simple.

arrHosts.question: How to manage a large group of people in the communication channel?
arrHosts.answer:
Especially when groups get bigger, it is important to make sure people aren’t bombarded with (irrelevant) messages. You can set up some rules for what should and shouldn’t be shared via the group app. For example:
  • Yes, in the app:
    • Selfies of nice things you took from the bag or nice things that you are putting in
    • Compliments to others (use the new emoticon function!)
    • Logistics and organizational relevant updates from the host
  • No, not in the app:
    • Everything unrelated to the Clothing Loop (requests for surveys, invites for new groups, Fund raising, memes, etc). If you want to ask everyone’s input on something, use a polling app like LouLou instead
    • Use the private message function when your message only concerns one person.

arrHosts.question: What if I no longer have time to manage the Clothing Loop I started?
arrHosts.answer: Use the group! Ask if someone else wants to help out hosting the Loop. Over time they may want to take over completely.

arrHosts.question: What if someone wants to join but lives too far away?
arrHosts.answer: If someone signed up for your Loop but lives too far outside of your Loop area, it is up to you to decide if they may join. If they cannot, please send them an email to let them know. When in doubt: one thing you can do to decrease the distance between addresses, is to ask that person to find other participants between their area and the original Loop location.

arrHosts.question: What is an ideal group size?
arrHosts.answer: We’d recommend having a minimum of 20 people in a group: after 20 addresses you usually do not recognise anything in the bag anymore, so you can continue swapping. There is no real maximum, it is up to you what still works! In the Netherlands an average Loop is 45 people. But there are Loops running smoothly with over 180 people!

arrHosts.question: What if somebody moves house and wants to join in another area?
arrHosts.answer: You as Loop host can remove them from your Loop when signed in on our website. If they want to join again in their new neighborhood, ask them to simply sign up again with their new address.

arrHosts.question: What to do if the Clothing Loop doesn’t work well?
arrHosts.answer:
Make sure that everyone shares the responsibility for only adding good quality items.

Do you see something that shouldn’t be in a bag? Try to donate it to your local textile recycling program. If in doubt, ask the person next to you on the address list if they agree. It is good to have a few people function as ‘checkpoints’ along the route, to make sure the bags stay in good condition. Because if the quality of the clothing isn’t high enough, people might leave the Loop and that would be a shame!

A fabric shaver can extend the lifetime of a clothing item enormously! You can share this advice within your community.

And last but not least, set a good example yourself: share some nice photos and encourage others to do the same! Seeing where items end up is a huge motivation for people to donate nice items.
